subject: sqlalchemy: add missing constraint delete_resource_type()
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-26 10:35:16.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/indexer/sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': "sqlalchemy: add missing constraint delete_resource_type()

This constraint can also be violated in certain circumstance:

    oslo_db.exception.DBReferenceError: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError)
    (1451, u'Cannot delete or update a parent row: a foreign key constraint fails (`test1070afa755f149838f0a6ddd523e68e2`.`resource_history`, CONSTRAINT `fk_resource_history_resource_type_name` FOREIGN KEY (`type`) REFERENCES `resource_type` (`name`))') [SQL: u'DELETE FROM resource_type WHERE resource_type.name = %(name)s'] [parameters: {'name': u'my_custom_resource'}]

Change-Id: Ic3eb36fcbbcdf3353e13745ba560d9c8a7b0a760
"}]
commit_message:
sqlalchemy: add missing constraint delete_resource_type()

This constraint can also be violated in certain circumstance:

    oslo_db.exception.DBReferenceError: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError)
    (1451, u'Cannot delete or update a parent row: a foreign key constraint fails (`test1070afa755f149838f0a6ddd523e68e2`.`resource_history`, CONSTRAINT `fk_resource_history_resource_type_name` FOREIGN KEY (`type`) REFERENCES `resource_type` (`name`))') [SQL: u'DELETE FROM resource_type WHERE resource_type.name = %(name)s'] [parameters: {'name': u'my_custom_resource'}]

Change-Id: Ic3eb36fcbbcdf3353e13745ba560d9c8a7b0a760

subject: sqlalchemy: no fail if resources and type are deleted under our feet
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-26 10:35:16.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/indexer/sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'sqlalchemy: no fail if resources and type are deleted under our feet

This is a rare case, but it can happen and did in one of our unit tests
run. When listing generic resources with details, the tables of some
resource types might disappear under our feet, at least with MySQL, and
that triggers an error:

sqlalchemy.exc.ProgrammingError: (pymysql.err.ProgrammingError)
  (1146, "Table \'test.rt_cd01a3f48e0345ebb55ac208de7b600f\' doesn\'t exist")

Change-Id: Ia7950052e06b1e2e9cc2651b04decc8d864972a7
'}]
commit_message:
sqlalchemy: no fail if resources and type are deleted under our feet

This is a rare case, but it can happen and did in one of our unit tests
run. When listing generic resources with details, the tables of some
resource types might disappear under our feet, at least with MySQL, and
that triggers an error:

sqlalchemy.exc.ProgrammingError: (pymysql.err.ProgrammingError)
  (1146, "Table \'test.rt_cd01a3f48e0345ebb55ac208de7b600f\' doesn\'t exist")

Change-Id: Ia7950052e06b1e2e9cc2651b04decc8d864972a7

commit_message:
composable heat services

Adds new puppet and puppet pacemaker specific services for
Heat API, Heat API CFN, Heat API Cloudwatch, and Heat Engine.

The Pacemaker templates extend the default heat services and
swap in the pacemaker specific puppet-tripleo profile instead.

Change-Id: I387b6bfd763d2d86cad68a3119b0edd0caa237b0
Partially-implements: blueprint composable-services-within-roles
Depends-On: I194cbb6aa307c2331597147545cf10299cab132f

commit_message:
Don't support floating ip if only specify 'network'

If only specify 'network' and 'floating_ip' for server nics,
the floating ip isn't be associated to server ports.
Due the ports are created out of heat, and heat doesn't know which
port should the floating ip to associated with. This change adds
validation of the case.

Change-Id: I1ee61d242d8ec9d756bd38f6b03c0751f740fd63
Closes-Bug: 1571992

This avoids this kind of errors:

oslo_db.exception.DBError: (psycopg2.InternalError) current transaction is aborted, commands ignored until end of transaction block
 [SQL: 'select relname from pg_class c join pg_namespace n on n.oid=c.relnamespace where pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid) and relname=%(name)s'] [parameters: {'name': u'rt_9e4a0e8695ef42ddae0f4ac73608b643'}]

Change-Id: I947fc74543c016cfcdf017f69b260f695702dc0a
"}]
commit_message:
sqlalchemy: retry on PostgreSQL catalog errors too

This avoids this kind of errors:

oslo_db.exception.DBError: (psycopg2.InternalError) current transaction is aborted, commands ignored until end of transaction block
 [SQL: 'select relname from pg_class c join pg_namespace n on n.oid=c.relnamespace where pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid) and relname=%(name)s'] [parameters: {'name': u'rt_9e4a0e8695ef42ddae0f4ac73608b643'}]

Change-Id: I947fc74543c016cfcdf017f69b260f695702dc0a

subject: Hyper-V: properly handle loopback shares
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 09:32:16.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/pathutils.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_volumeops.py', 'hyperv/nova/volumeops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_pathutils.py'], 'message': 'Hyper-V: properly handle loopback shares

At the moment, the Hyper-V driver uses the UNC path of images
stored on SMB shares, regardless if the share is remote or not.
According to the MS docs, this is not supported for SOFS SMB shares.

This is troublesome for the Hyper-C scenario, as Hyper-V will attempt
to modify the image ACLs, making them unusable.

The fix consists in checking if the share is local, and use the
local path in that case.

Closes-Bug: #1580122

(cherry-picked from b964f2bce3f3eeac3659e5ef50f520ee1da4afb0)
Change-Id: Ib736b39f3bfa58b2737647de23f741ffcf85180b
'}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V: properly handle loopback shares

At the moment, the Hyper-V driver uses the UNC path of images
stored on SMB shares, regardless if the share is remote or not.
According to the MS docs, this is not supported for SOFS SMB shares.

This is troublesome for the Hyper-C scenario, as Hyper-V will attempt
to modify the image ACLs, making them unusable.

The fix consists in checking if the share is local, and use the
local path in that case.

Closes-Bug: #1580122

(cherry-picked from b964f2bce3f3eeac3659e5ef50f520ee1da4afb0)
Change-Id: Ib736b39f3bfa58b2737647de23f741ffcf85180b

commit_message:
Accept host keys for console git tasks

The repo server role was updated to allow serving repositories over the
git protocol in I62321a7b62dabca469eb072ddbf4e8f250ce0fb3.

Update the git tasks checking out the novnc and spice console client
repositories to automatically accept host keys so that the git procotol
can become the default in the integrated openstack-ansible deployment.

Change-Id: I421b277e070dcc68ad69911473405f6d70cb01df

raise NoSuchMetric when deleting metric already marked deleted

we should hide the fact the metric is marked for deletion but not
yet deleted.

The Gabbi test has not been backported to avoid depending on a too
recent version of Gabbi.

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-05-21 00:12:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/connection.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/ovsdb/native/test_connection.py'], 'message': 'unit: fix ValueError on TransactionQueue init with py34

With native ovsdb_interface several py34 tests fail
with ValueError during ovs_lib.OVSBridge creation
because of unbuffered text I/O in TransactionQueue
initialization.
This patch fixes the issue by switching to binary mode
in os.fdopen

Change-Id: I4158cc24f6b28a290a4a4d4bec6c2383c6bf12aa
Closes-Bug: #1580270
'}]
commit_message:
unit: fix ValueError on TransactionQueue init with py34

With native ovsdb_interface several py34 tests fail
with ValueError during ovs_lib.OVSBridge creation
because of unbuffered text I/O in TransactionQueue
initialization.
This patch fixes the issue by switching to binary mode
in os.fdopen

Change-Id: I4158cc24f6b28a290a4a4d4bec6c2383c6bf12aa
Closes-Bug: #1580270

commit_message:
Ensure all role dependencies are consistently specified

We should always specify the 'scm' and 'version' attribute
for every role we depend upon.

Failure to do so can cause errors in certain 2.x versions
of Ansible.

Change-Id: Ia34cf414a4f60b2d51fcb852db573fa6a90b5672

commit_message:
Adjust Default configurations of Dragonflow

1. Set DF_PUB_SUB_USE_MULTIPROC to false if using redis pub/sub driver.
   Set SELECTIVE_TOPO_DIST according to pub/sub setting.

3. Fix bug caused pub/sub fullstack failure. Subscirbe corresponding
   topic when the event is publish by topic.

commit_message:
Modify --endpoint-type to --os-endpoint-type for nova

We are trying to remove deprecated option:
--endpoint-type in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317795/
so we should use --os-endpoint-type for nova now.

Change-Id: I2010424a38ba6b817235b507769893413ec27b34

Remove information about build time on specific hardware and reasons

Link to detailed instruction about image building from the quickstart
guide and update the image building guide to use `kolla-build` command

commit_message:
Simplify image building information in quickstart

Remove information about build time on specific hardware and reasons
for not pushing images per commit that are not relevant for
a quickstart guide.

Link to detailed instruction about image building from the quickstart
guide and update the image building guide to use `kolla-build` command
by default instead of `tools/build.py`.

Change-Id: If821370acdaaa860c96597aa373687f5f10d3121
Partially-implements: blueprint documentation-rework

commit_message:
sqlalchemy: retry on deadlock for create_resource_type()

sqlalchemy.exc.InternalError: (psycopg2.InternalError) current transaction is aborted, commands ignored until end of transaction block
     [SQL: 'select relname from pg_class c join pg_namespace n on n.oid=c.relnamespace where pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid) and relname=%(name)s'] [parameters: {'name': u'rt_c5a9affa3ef94951823f3d81d50932de'}]

Change-Id: Id77565677fddfc1d9b9edc074b8b808cfa23a1bd
(cherry picked from commit fb972acf990ce1289ae7cb08abdc475b73df2158)

commit_message:

when resetting network configuration to its deployed state.

Editable network attributes only should be updated.

Closes-Bug: #1570223

subject: add first basic unit test
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-26 10:31:58.000000000', 'files': ['os_api_ref/tests/base.py', 'os_api_ref/tests/test_basic_example.py', 'os_api_ref/tests/examples/basic/conf.py', 'requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'os_api_ref/tests/examples/basic/index.rst'], 'message': "add first basic unit test

This creates an simple stab at a pattern for building testing for
os-api-ref. The basic theory is that we'll create a set of example
directories that are full doc trees with markup. We can then build
them and test the HTML output.

HTML output testing is done using BeautifulSoup so we can get
normalized HTML snippets regardless of whitespace and wrapping.

Change-Id: Idf582d62a4353db74b31183869f80bbf01b5d0f0
"}]
commit_message:
add first basic unit test

This creates an simple stab at a pattern for building testing for
os-api-ref. The basic theory is that we'll create a set of example
directories that are full doc trees with markup. We can then build
them and test the HTML output.

HTML output testing is done using BeautifulSoup so we can get
normalized HTML snippets regardless of whitespace and wrapping.

Change-Id: Idf582d62a4353db74b31183869f80bbf01b5d0f0

sqlalchemy: avoid deadlock on list_metrics()

oslo_db.exception.DBDeadlock: (psycopg2.extensions.TransactionRollbackError) deadlock detected
LINE 2: ...name = metric.archive_policy_name LEFT OUTER JOIN resource A...
                                                             ^
DETAIL:  Process 19529 waits for AccessShareLock on relation 16425 of database 12066; blocked by process 19569.
Process 19569 waits for AccessExclusiveLock on relation 16441 of database 12066; blocked by process 19572.
Process 19572 waits for AccessExclusiveLock on relation 16425 of database 12066; blocked by process 19529.
HINT:  See server log for query details.
 [SQL: 'SELECT metric.id AS metric_id, metric.archive_policy_name AS metric_archive_policy_name, metric.created_by_user_id AS metric_created_by_user_id, metric.created_by_project_id AS metric_created_by_project_id, metric.resource_id AS metric_resource_id, metric.name AS metric_name, metric.status AS metric_status, archive_policy_1.name AS archive_policy_1_name, archive_policy_1.back_window AS archive_policy_1_back_window, archive_policy_1.definition AS archive_policy_1_definition, archive_policy_1.aggregation_methods AS archive_policy_1_aggregation_methods, resource_1.created_by_user_id AS resource_1_created_by_user_id, resource_1.created_by_project_id AS resource_1_created_by_project_id, resource_1.started_at AS resource_1_started_at, resource_1.revision_start AS resource_1_revision_start, resource_1.ended_at AS resource_1_ended_at, resource_1.user_id AS resource_1_user_id, resource_1.project_id AS resource_1_project_id, resource_1.original_resource_id AS resource_1_original_resource_id, resource_1.id AS resource_1_id, resource_1.type AS resource_1_type \nFROM metric LEFT OUTER JOIN archive_policy AS archive_policy_1 ON archive_policy_1.name = metric.archive_policy_name LEFT OUTER JOIN resource AS resource_1 ON resource_1.id = metric.resource_id AND metric.status = %(status_1)s \nWHERE metric.status = %(status_2)s AND metric.id = %(id_1)s ORDER BY metric.id'] [parameters: {'status_2': 'active', 'id_1': UUID('5c6b89cc-81a9-4dab-adc1-f015903531a2'), 'status_1': 'active'}]

commit_message:
Drop rendering of cinder.conf for deploy from source

The templates/cinder.conf file was removed recently causing this
code to fail.  Additionally I'm not sure why this code was
necessary in the first place since cinder.conf renders correctly
without it.

Closes-Bug: 1562931

Change-Id: I5c2dd88ba7b9a4fb22173ba43dc89775a2f6bb14

subject: CleanUp Error log traces in network context
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-24 05:48:09.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/plugins/openstack/context/network/test_network.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/context/network/networks.py'], 'message': 'CleanUp Error log traces in network context

Duplicated cleanup resources action causes fake log errors
in network context log. While rally is used for test and validate
other projects, it is important to generate correct and clear log
information.

commit_message:
CleanUp Error log traces in network context

Duplicated cleanup resources action causes fake log errors
in network context log. While rally is used for test and validate
other projects, it is important to generate correct and clear log
information.

This patch fix the bug.

Change-Id: I2c25ad60db0b396f69cb164646743032fc686445
Closes-Bug: #1570920

commit_message:
Add systemd init support for deploy from source

systemd is used instead of upstart by default since Ubuntu 15.10
(Wily).  This adds systemd init file support for cinder services
that are deployed from source.

commit_message:
Add support for user-provided ceph config

Adds a new config-flags option to the charm that
supports setting a dictionary of ceph configuration
settings that will be applied to ceph.conf.

This implementation supports config sections so that
settings can be applied to any section supported by
the ceph.conf template in the charm.

Change-Id: I5ed2530b1e06a4565029d62124b469b97e17d342
Closes-Bug: 1522375

This patch is a follow-up patch of
8e5e69869df476788b3ccf7e5ba6c2210a98fc8a addressing some the remaining
comments after the patch was merged. The changes are:

* Optimize the code by generating the list of reserved words for the
  nodes controller only once.

* List the reserved words in the release note.

* Improve the error string when someone tries to name a node using a
  reserved word.

* Add a comment for future reference indicating how we should try to
  model the API in case a new sub-controller needs to be added to the
  nodes controller class.

'}]
commit_message:
Follow-up patch of 8e5e69869df476788b3ccf7e5ba6c2210a98fc8a

This patch is a follow-up patch of
8e5e69869df476788b3ccf7e5ba6c2210a98fc8a addressing some the remaining
comments after the patch was merged. The changes are:

* Optimize the code by generating the list of reserved words for the
  nodes controller only once.

* List the reserved words in the release note.

* Improve the error string when someone tries to name a node using a
  reserved word.

* Add a comment for future reference indicating how we should try to
  model the API in case a new sub-controller needs to be added to the
  nodes controller class.

Change-Id: I43d6d9e2e92cc941a7839c60d9cd361cd94b6208

subject: Implement a Job for Mariadb Bootstrap
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-25 18:20:20.000000000', 'files': ['bootstrap/mariadb/mariadb-job.yml.j2', 'services/mariadb/mariadb-pod.yml.j2'], 'message': "Implement a Job for Mariadb Bootstrap

Using a Job and etcd, we can signal to Kubernetes when a bootstrapping
action is in progress and when it's complete.

When an action is in progress, the pods associated with the service will
poll etcd waiting for mariadb_bootstrapped to return true and exit(1).
Kubernetes will reschedule the pods until it passes.

The bootstrap container will manage the variable by signaling etcd
that a bootstrap is in progress. After the boostrap is complete,
the Job will exit(0) and not be rescheduled.

Change-Id: I06de8ebc347de3eab9aa58e8af85d9fa76182af5
Partially-implements: blueprint openstack-services
"}]
commit_message:
Implement a Job for Mariadb Bootstrap

Using a Job and etcd, we can signal to Kubernetes when a bootstrapping
action is in progress and when it's complete.

When an action is in progress, the pods associated with the service will
poll etcd waiting for mariadb_bootstrapped to return true and exit(1).
Kubernetes will reschedule the pods until it passes.

The bootstrap container will manage the variable by signaling etcd
that a bootstrap is in progress. After the boostrap is complete,
the Job will exit(0) and not be rescheduled.

Change-Id: I06de8ebc347de3eab9aa58e8af85d9fa76182af5
Partially-implements: blueprint openstack-services

Without this change Astute send only combined summary: part data
from last_run_summary and part data from last_run_report.
With this change user can setup Astute send detailed report in
summary by setup 'puppet_raw_report' in Astute config.
In this case Astute will also send raw_report field with

Change-Id: I52bd709fc3fdd44d5477f75bdb36d063a2754555
"}]
commit_message:
Support detailed puppet run report

Without this change Astute send only combined summary: part data
from last_run_summary and part data from last_run_report.
With this change user can setup Astute send detailed report in
summary by setup 'puppet_raw_report' in Astute config.
In this case Astute will also send raw_report field with
full puppet run report.

Change-Id: I52bd709fc3fdd44d5477f75bdb36d063a2754555

commit_message:
sqlalchemy: retry on deadlock for create_resource_type()

sqlalchemy.exc.InternalError: (psycopg2.InternalError) current transaction is aborted, commands ignored until end of transaction block
     [SQL: 'select relname from pg_class c join pg_namespace n on n.oid=c.relnamespace where pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid) and relname=%(name)s'] [parameters: {'name': u'rt_c5a9affa3ef94951823f3d81d50932de'}]

Change-Id: Id77565677fddfc1d9b9edc074b8b808cfa23a1bd

subject: Tuneup gabbi archive.yaml file to modern standards
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 20:20:31.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/gabbi/gabbits/archive.yaml'], 'message': "Tuneup gabbi archive.yaml file to modern standards

Make use of METHOD: /url shorthand to make the request method more
visible and more tightly associated with the url for easier reading.

Use $LAST_URL to refer to the URL of the previous request, but only
when the sameness of the URL is a relevant part of the expression of
the tests-in-sequence. (That is, don't just use LAST_URL because the
URL is the same.)

In one test use more complex json paths to confirm the details of
the list of archive policies.

Change-Id: Ic0b02b19bea121af9c21157443d0f1233b5f4e0c
"}]
commit_message:
Tuneup gabbi archive.yaml file to modern standards

Make use of METHOD: /url shorthand to make the request method more
visible and more tightly associated with the url for easier reading.

Use $LAST_URL to refer to the URL of the previous request, but only
when the sameness of the URL is a relevant part of the expression of
the tests-in-sequence. (That is, don't just use LAST_URL because the
URL is the same.)

In one test use more complex json paths to confirm the details of
the list of archive policies.

Change-Id: Ic0b02b19bea121af9c21157443d0f1233b5f4e0c

commit_message:
add support for non-default database_port in kolla/ansible

This change makes each step of the kolla deployment aware
of the port database was configured to listen on.
It defaults mariadb_port to database_port.

Change-Id: I8e85d5732015afc0a5481cb33e0b629fdfa84a1b
Closes-Bug: #1576151
DocImpact

subject: Tuneup gabbi archive_rule.yaml file to modern standards
revisions:

Make use of METHOD: /url shorthand to make the request method more
visible and more tightly associated with the url for easier reading.

In one place a status was move above a response_headers so that the
test more clearly aligns with the order of an HTTP request. This

commit_message:
Tuneup gabbi archive_rule.yaml file to modern standards

Make use of METHOD: /url shorthand to make the request method more
visible and more tightly associated with the url for easier reading.

In one place a status was move above a response_headers so that the
test more clearly aligns with the order of an HTTP request. This
isn't required by gabbi, but makes reading nice.

Change-Id: I37afcb780db8e9491fab5b03165ab1d8adccd0d2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-24 03:57:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/gpfs.py'], 'message': 'gpfs: remove a race in deleting volumes

"find" command may end with error if any of files in a target directory
is removed during its run. As we can/should ignore it and continue the
operation, we run "find" with -ignore_readdir_race option to stop
considering it an error.

Also, "find" runs with -print0 and -quit as it is a better practice.

Closes-bug: 1581670
Change-Id: Id26cb59d88082971465c8fcf0c150c858ab3bced
(cherry picked from commit e67110461afeb54c93e9af7ab2ad31a8bc304d8c)
'}]
commit_message:
gpfs: remove a race in deleting volumes

"find" command may end with error if any of files in a target directory
is removed during its run. As we can/should ignore it and continue the
operation, we run "find" with -ignore_readdir_race option to stop
considering it an error.

Also, "find" runs with -print0 and -quit as it is a better practice.

Closes-bug: 1581670
Change-Id: Id26cb59d88082971465c8fcf0c150c858ab3bced
(cherry picked from commit e67110461afeb54c93e9af7ab2ad31a8bc304d8c)

subject: Forced flush of tmp file to disk on ui retrieval
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-25 10:07:33.000000000', 'files': ['murano/api/v1/catalog.py'], 'message': "Forced flush of tmp file to disk on ui retrieval

UI retrieval routine loads the package's temporary file  from disk
to properly render its ui. This procedure does not close the file
before reading it, so the write buffers should be flushed first.

This was causing the bug when the UI could not be properly fetched
from the API.

Change-Id: I53cd08945c826dd18a7308f9f007d50241bb9041
Closes-bug: #1565805
"}]
commit_message:
Forced flush of tmp file to disk on ui retrieval

UI retrieval routine loads the package's temporary file  from disk
to properly render its ui. This procedure does not close the file
before reading it, so the write buffers should be flushed first.

This was causing the bug when the UI could not be properly fetched
from the API.

Change-Id: I53cd08945c826dd18a7308f9f007d50241bb9041
Closes-bug: #1565805

subject: bagpipe: really use the extension-specific cookie
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-18 20:42:05.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/services/bagpipe/test_bagpipe.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/bagpipe/agent_extension.py'], 'message': 'bagpipe: really use the extension-specific cookie

The code in OVSBridgeIntercept was not behaving
as intended:
- the extension cookie was not applied as expected, even
  for the ofctl-based OVSTunnelBridge (interference with
  class inheritance, because __getattr__ does not let us
  override methods existing in a parent class,
  __getattribute__ has to be used instead)
- the extension cookie would never have been applied
  for the native.OVSTunnelBridge that does not use add_flow

This changes corrects the code and adds a test case.

We also now import the neutron constants from neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I779d7a8bf7fc31d936d1e401e4726711c8404ed2
Closes-Bug: 1582598
'}]
commit_message:
bagpipe: really use the extension-specific cookie

The code in OVSBridgeIntercept was not behaving
as intended:
- the extension cookie was not applied as expected, even
  for the ofctl-based OVSTunnelBridge (interference with
  class inheritance, because __getattr__ does not let us
  override methods existing in a parent class,
  __getattribute__ has to be used instead)
- the extension cookie would never have been applied
  for the native.OVSTunnelBridge that does not use add_flow

This changes corrects the code and adds a test case.

We also now import the neutron constants from neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I779d7a8bf7fc31d936d1e401e4726711c8404ed2
Closes-Bug: 1582598

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 09:26:02.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/glance-image-id-d1a32b5ec443611e.yaml', 'spec/unit/provider/glance_image_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_image.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/glance_image/openstack.rb'], 'message': 'Add option id to glance_image

In glance, user can specify the desired id when creating
a new image. This can be convenient for some cases where

commit_message:
Add option id to glance_image

In glance, user can specify the desired id when creating
a new image. This can be convenient for some cases where
users want predictable ids for image, as referencing ramdisk_id
or kernel_id for AMI images.

Change-Id: I7868f2005041dea6ecd63cd601e9244cefd08e5b

commit_message:
Fix delete vif_port_id for sync cleaning

If cleaning is sync conductor releases a lock only after cleaning
completed, and Nova delete instance failed because Ironic virt
driver can not remove vif_port_id.
This patch adds a workaround that fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Iccdf84313edaf00d8002529dc62c5a6a36c0dbba
Closes-Bug: #1522008

commit_message:
Add enable_proxy_headers_parsing option

This option determines if the middleware should parse the
proxy-related headers or not. Can be used in case if
application is behind the reverse proxy.

commit_message:
Add support for API microversions in Tempest tests

This adds support for testing Ironic API microversions, specified
as an additional 'X-OpenStack-Ironic-API-Version' header. This change
also adds tests for Ironic API /v1/nodes/(node_ident)/states/*
endpoint for microversions that were changing state machine.

Co-Authored-By: Vladyslav Drok <vdrok@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ibf0c73aa6795aaa52e945fd6baa821de20a599e7

subject: Limit the frequency of db sync
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-05-26 03:45:40.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/db/api_nb.py', 'dragonflow/db/db_common.py'], 'message': 'Limit the frequency of db sync

If exception occurs when processing a northbound event, one second delay
will be introduced by db sync, it leads to more exceptions because of
the delay. Avalanche will occur then. This patch limits the frequency of
db sync by one time every three minutes at maximum.

Closes-Bug: #1583992

Change-Id: I2f2635467b8fc5ab816ea4ac355e3e1cc488d5a2
'}]
commit_message:
Limit the frequency of db sync

If exception occurs when processing a northbound event, one second delay
will be introduced by db sync, it leads to more exceptions because of
the delay. Avalanche will occur then. This patch limits the frequency of
db sync by one time every three minutes at maximum.

Closes-Bug: #1583992

Change-Id: I2f2635467b8fc5ab816ea4ac355e3e1cc488d5a2

subject: Implement non-default signal handler for SIGINT
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-06 21:43:44.000000000', 'files': ['kolla/cmd/build.py'], 'message': "Implement non-default signal handler for SIGINT

Pressing Ctrl-C will stop a build, but does not clean up the /tmp
directory of dockerfiles. Implement a signal handler such that clean up
does occur.

Python apparently ignores signals while calling join on a queue, so
that's why the small modification was needed there.

Change-Id: I43faf67726c154b6640d3596aea61ffc59871999
Closes-Bug: #1579242
"}]
commit_message:
Implement non-default signal handler for SIGINT

Pressing Ctrl-C will stop a build, but does not clean up the /tmp
directory of dockerfiles. Implement a signal handler such that clean up
does occur.

Python apparently ignores signals while calling join on a queue, so
that's why the small modification was needed there.

Change-Id: I43faf67726c154b6640d3596aea61ffc59871999
Closes-Bug: #1579242

subject: Manual sync from global-requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 03:28:14.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'setup.py'], 'message': 'Manual sync from global-requirements

In review I94f6f5f853078feeccaea0c50e5690101f95e318 tricircle is asking
to be added to projects.txt.  Doing so will mean that when
global-requirements.txt is altered in a away that directly impacts
tricircle an automated (by proposal-bot) review similar to this one will
be generated.

This review manually performs this sync so that the first bot generated
change will be smaller and easier to review.

This introduces several significant changes (eventlet, ovo, Babel) so
please test carefully.

Change-Id: Ib2b7ed2671a5ad8d2a6262e07e0bbc5f921abf33
'}]
commit_message:
Manual sync from global-requirements

In review I94f6f5f853078feeccaea0c50e5690101f95e318 tricircle is asking
to be added to projects.txt.  Doing so will mean that when
global-requirements.txt is altered in a away that directly impacts
tricircle an automated (by proposal-bot) review similar to this one will
be generated.

This review manually performs this sync so that the first bot generated
change will be smaller and easier to review.

This introduces several significant changes (eventlet, ovo, Babel) so
please test carefully.

Change-Id: Ib2b7ed2671a5ad8d2a6262e07e0bbc5f921abf33

commit_message:
Tox test should respect upper-constraints

This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
world changes in a way that you don't expect.

Change-Id: I175240a59ee7ee9562db96ddf73d402c703f8e20
Closes-Bug: #1563038

The original fakes included a lot of unneeded pasted code from
openstackclient. This change replaces the client with a single

commit_message:
Clean up osc fakes and mocks

The original fakes included a lot of unneeded pasted code from
openstackclient. This change replaces the client with a single
MagicMock, and deletes unused fakes classes.

Since the base client is a magic mock, a significant amount of mock
object creation has been replaced with the magic equivalent.

This change actually revealed a faulty test,
test_deployment_config_delete_failed should be asserting that deleting
the derived config is best-effort and does not raise an error.

Change-Id: I11be97603b2d42ea70dde7d936e11d15e7f5709e

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-24 17:13:30.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/pecan_wsgi/controllers/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/pecan_wsgi/test_controllers.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/hooks/policy_enforcement.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/controllers/resource.py'], 'message': "Pecan: tell the plugin about field selection

Neutron plugin are able to do field selection on responses (for
instance only returning id & name for a resource). However,
Pecan does not leverage this capability and always tells the
plugin to fetch all fields, doing field selection while
processing the response.

This patch ensures that pecan send the field list down to the
plugin.

As a part of this patch TestRequestProcessing has been update
to inherit from TestRootController rather than
TestResourceController. Inheriting from the latter was causing
tests to be executed twice for no reason, beyong using
TestResourceController's 'port' attribute, which was however
unnecessary as this change proves.

Closes-Bug: #1570259

Change-Id: Iac930cd3bb14dfdda78e6a94d2c8bef2b5c4b9a5
"}]
commit_message:
Pecan: tell the plugin about field selection

Neutron plugin are able to do field selection on responses (for
instance only returning id & name for a resource). However,
Pecan does not leverage this capability and always tells the
plugin to fetch all fields, doing field selection while
processing the response.

This patch ensures that pecan send the field list down to the
plugin.

As a part of this patch TestRequestProcessing has been update
to inherit from TestRootController rather than
TestResourceController. Inheriting from the latter was causing
tests to be executed twice for no reason, beyong using
TestResourceController's 'port' attribute, which was however
unnecessary as this change proves.

Closes-Bug: #1570259

Change-Id: Iac930cd3bb14dfdda78e6a94d2c8bef2b5c4b9a5

commit_message:
Automatically enable neutron ha router capabilities

This change will automatically set the variable `horizon_enable_ha_router` to
True if the neutron plugin type is ML2 and the environment has >=2 l3 agent
nodes. This will provide extra functionality in horizon to manage HA routers.

Change-Id: I73c48163927673900befd4dbce631d0ee79994e5
Depends-On: I5edb7576d977bc558d9411dca62a029eb1856000
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Nova deprecated 2.0 API in Liberty and will remove it in Newton.

This patch does 3 things:
* in nova::keystone::auth, create nova API 2.1 endpoints by default and
  not 2.0 anymore that is going to be removed.
  puppet-keystone will update endpoints for the 'compute' service with
  the new URL.
* in nova::keystone::auth, deprecate all parameters related to v3. They
  are useless, since we now use v2.1 by default and it's the version
  that is what v3 started out as.
  Note: puppet-keystone won't remove the v3 endpoint. You can do it with
  puppet-keystone or manually.
* deprecate osapi_v3 in nova::api. The parameter is useless and does not
  need to bet set.

List of parameters deprecated:
* osapi_v3
* auth_name_v3
* service_description_v3
* service_name_v3
* public_url_v3
* internal_url_v3
* admin_url_v3
* configure_endpoint_v3

They have no effect and will be removed in a future release.

Change-Id: I8990ce21745fa7a995b92ed337622fa6ffc2756b
"}]
commit_message:
Switch API to 2.1 and deprecate 3

Nova deprecated 2.0 API in Liberty and will remove it in Newton.

This patch does 3 things:
* in nova::keystone::auth, create nova API 2.1 endpoints by default and
  not 2.0 anymore that is going to be removed.
  puppet-keystone will update endpoints for the 'compute' service with
  the new URL.
* in nova::keystone::auth, deprecate all parameters related to v3. They
  are useless, since we now use v2.1 by default and it's the version
  that is what v3 started out as.
  Note: puppet-keystone won't remove the v3 endpoint. You can do it with
  puppet-keystone or manually.
* deprecate osapi_v3 in nova::api. The parameter is useless and does not
  need to bet set.

List of parameters deprecated:
* osapi_v3
* auth_name_v3
* service_description_v3
* service_name_v3
* public_url_v3
* internal_url_v3
* admin_url_v3
* configure_endpoint_v3

They have no effect and will be removed in a future release.

Change-Id: I8990ce21745fa7a995b92ed337622fa6ffc2756b

commit_message:
Add hacking check to prevent assert_called_once

We've had a few patches now over the last few releases to fix invalid
mock assertions for assert_called_once. Rather than keep letting these
creep back in to the code, this adds a hacking check to watch for this
specific call and block it.

Change-Id: I3cf4df523ddba49f57dd1d4d23e95e6d62d03c9e

commit_message:
Use a weakref for the data object context

There are no known circular reference issues caused by storing the
context in data objects, but the following changes will refer to data
objects in the context, so this change prevents any later issues.

Change-Id: I3680e5678003cf339a98fbb7a2b1b387fb2243c0
Related-Bug: #1578854

commit_message:
Dell SC: Changed rename volume REST API call

The Dell SC REST API call for renaming a volume should be a
put StorageCenter/ScVolume/{instanceId} call and not a post
StorageCenter/ScVolume/{instanceId}/Modify call. They both
work but the post might go away in the future.

Change-Id: I0ecc757e097e4f73bee1ea345a12da5ecce137b6

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-24 21:35:54.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/static_route_error_check-5e7ed6ddf9eb1d1f.yaml', 'playbooks/inventory/dynamic_inventory.py', 'tests/test_inventory.py', 'doc/source/install-guide/configure-networking.rst'], 'message': 'Test static route settings

Provider networks can be given static route information that is
populated on all containers. This commit only tests the common cases
around that code - adding a static route as expected, and attempting to
add one with missing information.

Currently, the code fails silently if the cidr or gateway for a static
route are missing. This change adds an exception informing the user that
there is missing static route information. The information is
purposefully general (no specific cases for missing cidr/gateway) in
order to keep the conditionals simple in the code.

Also, the change now checks to make sure that a value is present in
addition to the key, and the variable names are clarified. The values
provided are not check to be valid CIDRs or IP addresses at this time.

A release note and documentation were added given the new errors.

The test cases were split into their own class so as to reduce the
sprawl in the TestConfigChecks class.

Change-Id: I7e36736c1dbd86b7131365b6c27ff2c221814059
'}]
commit_message:
Test static route settings

Provider networks can be given static route information that is
populated on all containers. This commit only tests the common cases
around that code - adding a static route as expected, and attempting to
add one with missing information.

Currently, the code fails silently if the cidr or gateway for a static
route are missing. This change adds an exception informing the user that
there is missing static route information. The information is
purposefully general (no specific cases for missing cidr/gateway) in
order to keep the conditionals simple in the code.

Also, the change now checks to make sure that a value is present in
addition to the key, and the variable names are clarified. The values
provided are not check to be valid CIDRs or IP addresses at this time.

A release note and documentation were added given the new errors.

The test cases were split into their own class so as to reduce the
sprawl in the TestConfigChecks class.

Change-Id: I7e36736c1dbd86b7131365b6c27ff2c221814059

commit_message:
Tune health manager module

Tune the health manager module in prep for adding event listener. This
patch corrected some incorrect parameter passing problems and added some
more assertions in the test case.

subject: [WIP]Fix pool creation when subnets already existing
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1923, 'name': 'Mohammad Banikazemi', 'email': 'mbanikazemi@gmail.com', 'username': 'mb-s'}, {'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 11343, 'name': 'Gal Sagie', 'email': 'gal.sagie@gmail.com', 'username': 'GalSagie'}, {'_account_id': 12069, 'name': 'Taku Fukushima', 'email': 'f.tac.mac@gmail.com', 'username': 'tfukushima'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 04:08:57.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr/controllers.py'], 'message': "[WIP]Fix pool creation when subnets already existing

Existing code was not ipam_request_address, check for address_type.
If it is gateway then dont go to port creation. Earlier in previous
libnetwork versions this 'request_address_type' field was not being
passed to remote drivers.

WIP for unt tests.

Closes-bug: #1584286
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP]Fix pool creation when subnets already existing

Existing code was not ipam_request_address, check for address_type.
If it is gateway then dont go to port creation. Earlier in previous
libnetwork versions this 'request_address_type' field was not being
passed to remote drivers.

WIP for unt tests.

Change-Id: I029174f377066e93bb2300d91e7fedfc6ab4dfac
Closes-bug: #1584286

commit_message:
Added os_endpoint_type to various OpenStack clients

Currently, openstack_clients.py registers 'os-endpoint-type' as an
allowed option but doesn't pass it to client init functions other
than swiftclient. It should be passed alongside region_name.

Change-Id: I54b288776a6c2cf9c1eeb30cb7d2036bd3fd7652
Closes-Bug: #1579865

subject: Fix post jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-24 21:58:50.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix post jobs

The tox venv environment is run during post jobs and thus cannot use
constraints.

See:
http://logs.openstack.org/db/db7bdf9aa0cb0ba5fbae5ae07ecdb9f024213deb/post/keystone-docs/92d1e87/
http://logs.openstack.org/db/db7bdf9aa0cb0ba5fbae5ae07ecdb9f024213deb/post/keystone-branch-tarball/eb685ad/

We run for docs jobs:
"tox -e venv python setup.py build_sphinx"

thus, the docs environment is not used.

For branch tarball, the infra scripts use:
"tox -e venv python setup.py sdist"

And infra does not setup constraints for post jobs currently as this is
not working with current tools

Fix tox.ini for this

Change-Id: I048368981e4be739c66073fdd9bc8a9663498a80
(cherry picked from commit 2535f22e6123bd8b7ae1304b31f6748e631d8e61)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix post jobs

The tox venv environment is run during post jobs and thus cannot use
constraints.

See:
http://logs.openstack.org/db/db7bdf9aa0cb0ba5fbae5ae07ecdb9f024213deb/post/keystone-docs/92d1e87/
http://logs.openstack.org/db/db7bdf9aa0cb0ba5fbae5ae07ecdb9f024213deb/post/keystone-branch-tarball/eb685ad/

We run for docs jobs:
"tox -e venv python setup.py build_sphinx"

thus, the docs environment is not used.

For branch tarball, the infra scripts use:
"tox -e venv python setup.py sdist"

And infra does not setup constraints for post jobs currently as this is
not working with current tools

Fix tox.ini for this

Change-Id: I048368981e4be739c66073fdd9bc8a9663498a80
(cherry picked from commit 2535f22e6123bd8b7ae1304b31f6748e631d8e61)

subject: Fix senlin-dashboard install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 01:40:51.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/senlin'], 'message': 'Fix senlin-dashboard install

When setting up tempest gate for senlin api test, we are currently
running git-clone on senlin-dashboard. It is unnecessary and it is
rejected by devstack. This patch propose a separate path for develop
setup of senlin-dashboard. Hopefully, it will not impact any production
setup while it leaves us some room for getting tempest gate up asap.

Change-Id: I314cf2e01e889a8c19fa819090ceacb98ee885eb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix senlin-dashboard install

When setting up tempest gate for senlin api test, we are currently
running git-clone on senlin-dashboard. It is unnecessary and it is
rejected by devstack. This patch propose a separate path for develop
setup of senlin-dashboard. Hopefully, it will not impact any production
setup while it leaves us some room for getting tempest gate up asap.

Change-Id: I314cf2e01e889a8c19fa819090ceacb98ee885eb

commit_message:
Deprecate use_syslog and enable_v1/v2_api

[DEFAULT/use_syslog] was deprecated in Mitaka [1] init.pp logging.pp -
deprecate use_syslog, add warning, remove reference tests - remove use_syslog
and [DEFAULT/use_syslog] verification.

enable_v1/v2_api was deprecated in Mitaka [2] init.pp
deprecate enable_v1_api, enable_v2_api
add warning
remove tests

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/config-reference/tables/conf-changes/cinder.html

Change-Id: I76fd567f53ef8f0f4d351d52043e3ba2fea6f02f

commit_message:
De-duplicate raw_template.files

Save space in the db by allowing templates (especially nested
templates) to reference the same template files dictionary objects,
now stored in the table raw_template_files. Also, cache template files
per heat-engine process as a RAM/performance optimization.

Also, begin to allow for future rolling upgrades with
oslo.versionedobjects.

Change-Id: I1842ea6ba6773a135b1007b793a5f0884417747d
Closes-Bug: 1570983

revisions:

Providing VPNaaS service in networking environments that have their own

Change-Id: Ibeca1c040fde19c07ac3278494300dca7f742b35
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Decouple VPNaaS from Neutron L3 agent

Providing VPNaaS service in networking environments that have their own
L3 implementations (such as OVN), requires the VPNaaS logic to be
decoupled from the Neutron L3 agent.  Regardless of how this decoupling
is accomplished, it is desirable to reuse as much of the existing VPNaaS
server and agent logic as possible.

An RFE bug, a blueprint/spec, and testcases have not been created
because I’m still trying to determine best direction forward to handle
this requirement.

Related changes to the networking-ovn repo can be found:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/309089/

Change-Id: Ibeca1c040fde19c07ac3278494300dca7f742b35

subject: [WIP] Add support for VPNaaS
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-22 19:12:24.000000000', 'files': ['vagrant/provisioning/setup-compute.sh', 'vagrant/provisioning/setup-vpnremote.sh', 'vpnaas/README.rst', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/test_ovn_plugin.py', 'vagrant/provisioning/setup-controller.sh', 'etc/l3_agent.ini', 'etc/vpn_agent.ini', 'vagrant/provisioning/virtualbox.conf.yml', 'vpnaas/vpnaas.local.conf', 'vagrant/Vagrantfile', 'networking_ovn/plugin.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Add support for VPNaaS

There are a number of ways that VPNaaS support can be added to OVN. The
current VPNaaS support in neutron is built on top of the L3 router. Work
was done to decouple the VPNaaS logic from the L3 rotuer in patch:

   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/298323/

In order to reuse the existing neutron VPNaaS code base, a neutron DB
router object and an IP namespace are required. This patch, used in
conjunction with the one listed above, will allow two different types of
routers to be active: the normal OVN router and an agent based VPN
specific router. In order to distinguishing between the two types of
routers, the router name field is being used. Obviously that will need
to change.

Requiring a 2nd router for the VPN traffic is not ideal and it is not
consistent with the current neutron VPNaaS user experience today. It
may be possible to reuse the existing neutron router object created for
an OVN router and add-on the additional VPNaaS fields that are required.
It would be nice if the existing RPC L3/VPN flows to the agent code
could be preserved without change, but that might not be possible. Work
to move to a single OVN router is ongoing. Feedback and suggestions are
welcome. This patch will be updated as that work progresses.

Change-Id: I5ef955302da4a7d7b8ea92eea2da46805d5256a3
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Add support for VPNaaS

There are a number of ways that VPNaaS support can be added to OVN. The
current VPNaaS support in neutron is built on top of the L3 router. Work
was done to decouple the VPNaaS logic from the L3 rotuer in patch:

   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/298323/

In order to reuse the existing neutron VPNaaS code base, a neutron DB
router object and an IP namespace are required. This patch, used in
conjunction with the one listed above, will allow two different types of
routers to be active: the normal OVN router and an agent based VPN
specific router. In order to distinguishing between the two types of
routers, the router name field is being used. Obviously that will need
to change.

Requiring a 2nd router for the VPN traffic is not ideal and it is not
consistent with the current neutron VPNaaS user experience today. It
may be possible to reuse the existing neutron router object created for
an OVN router and add-on the additional VPNaaS fields that are required.
It would be nice if the existing RPC L3/VPN flows to the agent code
could be preserved without change, but that might not be possible. Work
to move to a single OVN router is ongoing. Feedback and suggestions are
welcome. This patch will be updated as that work progresses.

Change-Id: I5ef955302da4a7d7b8ea92eea2da46805d5256a3

subject: Avoid conflict between new flavor name and existent flavor ID
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-21 05:50:32.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1584025-fa8b62ec3473a7ba.yaml', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/flavor.py', 'openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_flavor.py'], 'message': 'Avoid conflict between new flavor name and existent flavor ID

The ID of existent flavors are particular because they are
not uuid but string.(Such as "1","2","42","c1","d3"...)
So if we create a new flavor,the new flavor name may be the
same as a existent flavor id,and then there will be some errors.

So I think it is necessary to judge whether the new name is
available or not before creating the new flavor.

Change-Id: Ie4c66e6de59654ab645dec857d001a487e5d35b7
Closes-Bug: #1584025
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid conflict between new flavor name and existent flavor ID

The ID of existent flavors are particular because they are
not uuid but string.(Such as "1","2","42","c1","d3"...)
So if we create a new flavor,the new flavor name may be the
same as a existent flavor id,and then there will be some errors.

So I think it is necessary to judge whether the new name is
available or not before creating the new flavor.

Change-Id: Ie4c66e6de59654ab645dec857d001a487e5d35b7
Closes-Bug: #1584025

commit_message:
Use Notification Pools by Default

Using notifications pools is now the recommended way
to deploy searchlight, so this patch updates Searchlight
to use notification pools by default and to use
the same notification topic as ceilometer.

Change-Id: I2556128ae7ba2b05a0f1a997676083a394f8c388
See: Ie40876e88059d0326efa0b4abaa76b8b64f0b86b
Partial-Bug: #1583215

subject: Remove integrated jobs from neutron-dynamic-routing project config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 04:47:49.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove integrated jobs from neutron-dynamic-routing project config

The neutron integrated jobs (gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full and
gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron) are not configured to run the dynamic
routing extension, so running these jobs is not only wasteful but
slow down pace of develoment.

Since there is not even a remote chance that commits against this
project can break the integrated jobs, they can be safely removed.

Change-Id: I77401df645451c9ae218bd8b9855cc2725de9756
'}]
commit_message:
Remove integrated jobs from neutron-dynamic-routing project config

The neutron integrated jobs (gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full and
gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron) are not configured to run the dynamic
routing extension, so running these jobs is not only wasteful but
slow down pace of develoment.

Since there is not even a remote chance that commits against this
project can break the integrated jobs, they can be safely removed.

Change-Id: I77401df645451c9ae218bd8b9855cc2725de9756

commit_message:
openstack overcloud software deployment show

CLI command which shows the status of a software deployment, including
any stdout/stderr from its execution.

Deployments are referenced by the server name, and the deployment name
(or deployment ID, or derived config ID). This allows
"openstack overcloud software deployment show" to be run after running
"openstack overcloud software deployment list"

Change-Id: Iff15e4b1b9d5177ff4919aa005d338d7dd1f73ce
Depends-On: I3fb586ad33e3024b5ce29bb6b8c8accd3661e745
Blueprint: tripleo-manage-software-deployments

subject: Implement ViewManager show_software_deployment
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-29 21:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tripleo_common/core/view.py', 'tripleo_common/tests/test_view.py'], 'message': 'Implement ViewManager show_software_deployment

This is provides a software deployment lookup based on the node name and
the deployment name. It can be used to fetch a single deployment using
the data returned from list_software_deployments.

As well as the deployment name, the deployment UUID or the derived
config UUID can also be used, maximising the chance that any identifier
the user finds will work (such as in os-collect-config logs).

Change-Id: I3fb586ad33e3024b5ce29bb6b8c8accd3661e745
Blueprint: tripleo-manage-software-deployments
'}]
commit_message:
Implement ViewManager show_software_deployment

This is provides a software deployment lookup based on the node name and
the deployment name. It can be used to fetch a single deployment using
the data returned from list_software_deployments.

As well as the deployment name, the deployment UUID or the derived
config UUID can also be used, maximising the chance that any identifier
the user finds will work (such as in os-collect-config logs).

Change-Id: I3fb586ad33e3024b5ce29bb6b8c8accd3661e745
Blueprint: tripleo-manage-software-deployments

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError when obtaining 'name' attribute from 'snap'

As the type of snap is dict, we should use snap['name'] instead.

Change-Id: Ic5e41adc32c873f32c02c49e5e45e111d958f963
Closes-bug: #1583856

subject: DRAFT: Enable cross-process communication in the Data Services Engine
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-20 05:45:22.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/dist-cross-process-dse.rst'], 'message': 'DRAFT: Enable cross-process communication in the Data Services Engine

Currently, Congress data source and policy engine modules must reside
in a GreenThread in the same Python process. We aim to refactor the
data services engine (DSE) messaging wrapper to enable cross-process
messaging. The oslo.messaging framework will be used to facilitate
module communication.

blueprint dist-cross-project-dse

Change-Id: I1200f71da220d53e4ea24b6ae513352e33c92f6b
'}]
commit_message:
DRAFT: Enable cross-process communication in the Data Services Engine

Currently, Congress data source and policy engine modules must reside
in a GreenThread in the same Python process. We aim to refactor the
data services engine (DSE) messaging wrapper to enable cross-process
messaging. The oslo.messaging framework will be used to facilitate
module communication.

blueprint dist-cross-project-dse

Change-Id: I1200f71da220d53e4ea24b6ae513352e33c92f6b

commit_message:
Add insecure_registry column to baymoddel

Adding new column of `insecure_registry`, it indicates using insecure
registry when deploying a bay, it should be a validate url with port.

Partially-Implements: blueprint support-insecure-registry
Change-Id: Iaa28d6409264d1d2acd992a7fa14630bb6394852

commit_message:
Update Magnum service name and description

After this patch [1], Magnum is no longer the "Container Service", it
became the "Container Infrastructure Management Service". This commit
updates the service name and description accordingly:
* Change service name from "container" to "container-infra"
* Update service description to reflect its mission

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311476/

Depends-On: I55205ff2b304678d2b53bbd4d66403078c6baac8
Closes-Bug: #1584251
Change-Id: I5c271bf3fc4d6ccecaf2918aca28ce946bcc6b22

Phase(I): Scale cpu/memory of instances without guest numa architecture
Phase(II): Scale cpu/memory of instances with defined guest numa architecture
Phase(III): Live migrate if local compute node does not have enough resources

NOTE: This patch is not currently intended to be merged.
Instead, this patch intends to just demonstrate feasibility of Phase(I)
and provide an indication on feature complexity.

Change-Id: I04b0db1dc04e68ee469ed7fb385a13d4def27973
'}]
commit_message:
Scale-instance: Scale virtual CPUs and memory of live instances

Phase(I): Scale cpu/memory of instances without guest numa architecture
Phase(II): Scale cpu/memory of instances with defined guest numa architecture
Phase(III): Live migrate if local compute node does not have enough resources

NOTE: This patch is not currently intended to be merged.
Instead, this patch intends to just demonstrate feasibility of Phase(I)
and provide an indication on feature complexity.

Change-Id: I04b0db1dc04e68ee469ed7fb385a13d4def27973

commit_message:
Add oslo_config PortOpt support

As oslo_config profides PortOpt type to validate the range of port
now, we could change port to PortOpt from IntOpt.

Change-Id: I341f679e939f7c2fedf937bba971c36cd603b752

commit_message:
Implement custom header support for Octavia

Implements support for custom header insertion in Octavia.
A listener may be configured to insert custom headers which are
supported by Octavia. Currently implemented support for
X-Forwarded-For header, and X-Forwarded-Port

commit_message:
VMware: anti-affinity placement scheduling for cluster

A cluster in vcenter is exposed as a compute node on nova.
There can be a maximum of 64 hosts per cluster.
Currently, for an instance/server group, ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter
would schedule only one instance per cluster. The maximum number of
instances from a server group can only be equal to number of
clusters/compute nodes.

This patch adds a new capability 'resource_scheduling' and used in
scheduler filters.
ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter behavior is fixed
such that if the driver+host has 'resource_scheduling' capabilities
then select the host and pass the anti-affinity placement to be done
done by vcenter [1].
This change would allow deploying more instances within a cluster.

[1] http://tinyurl.com/qfyc6t8

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint vmware-placement-policy

Change-Id: I03cc9c53c75feea8287d4354c7562d398134e0b8

commit_message:
*Nova can incorrectly think an instance is volume backed
if instance is booted with "nova boot...",it confuses api.py &
assume if image_ref isn't set then theinstance is volume backed.
closes Bug: #1501851

Change-Id: I1aace00479274d20435b178aa8f6e425ad9b6e9f

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-28 16:36:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Ironic: Do not wait for the node to be unprovisioned

Ironic will now allow a deployment to be interrupted at any stage. But
for some states where it can not be immediately stopped Ironic will just
mark that node and the unprovisioning will be deferred to later.

This patch patch then:

1) Allows unprovision to be called when the node is at DEPLOYING state
(which was not possible to be interrupted before)

2) Do not loop and pool the node being unprovisioned, Ironic will take

Closes-Bug: #1477490
Related blueprint lazy-delete-instances
Change-Id: I996b2970992995e27dc03af6109481e4a20df15a
'}]
commit_message:
Ironic: Do not wait for the node to be unprovisioned

Ironic will now allow a deployment to be interrupted at any stage. But
for some states where it can not be immediately stopped Ironic will just
mark that node and the unprovisioning will be deferred to later.

This patch patch then:

1) Allows unprovision to be called when the node is at DEPLOYING state
(which was not possible to be interrupted before)

2) Do not loop and pool the node being unprovisioned, Ironic will take
care of tearing the node down when possible.

Closes-Bug: #1477490
Related blueprint lazy-delete-instances
Change-Id: I996b2970992995e27dc03af6109481e4a20df15a

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-10-13 20:11:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt live-migration: Monitoring task tracks progress watermark incorrectly

It is possible for a libvirt to report libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_UNBOUNDED
in _live_migration_monitor but return 0s for data_remaining, which in
turn makes out progress watermark 0 which is lower than it is likely to
get during the migration and basically useless to report as it is going to be 0.

This patch checks to ensure that data_remaining is greater than 0
prior to setting the progress_watermark value when libvirt reports
libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_UNBOUNDED.

Change-Id: Ic38ad783a0ed6ecce9bac903eafde3c7e243f791
Closes-Bug: #1499449
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt live-migration: Monitoring task tracks progress watermark incorrectly

It is possible for a libvirt to report libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_UNBOUNDED
in _live_migration_monitor but return 0s for data_remaining, which in
turn makes out progress watermark 0 which is lower than it is likely to
get during the migration and basically useless to report as it is going to be 0.

This patch checks to ensure that data_remaining is greater than 0
prior to setting the progress_watermark value when libvirt reports
libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_JOB_UNBOUNDED.

Change-Id: Ic38ad783a0ed6ecce9bac903eafde3c7e243f791
Closes-Bug: #1499449

commit_message:
Add support for yfs storage protocol

The cinder driver for Daowoo YeeSan(bp: cinder-driver-for-yeesan)
introduces a new storage protocol `yfs`. This protocol currently only
support libvirt and qemu. This patch add a new volume driver to
support yfs protocol for libvirt.

Implements: blueprint support-yfs-storage-protocol
Change-Id: I3cc12f745c8db08673d45f4642d4f097b1f7ad82
Depends-On: I6a3d2290ac326f24257af663c014596c4cf842a9

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Partial-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
VMware: Append disk type to image cache folder name

When spawning a new instance, vmware driver creates
and caches vmdk from glance image. For any new instances
based on same image, it reuses the cached vmdk as source.

Even when the disk type (preallocated, streamOptimized, sparse)
of the image is updated on glance, nova continues to use the
same cached image file.
This causes issue reported in bug #1339342.

In this patch, the image cache folder name on nova is appended
with disk type such that a new image corresponding to disk type
is created and cached.

Change-Id: I96eec4389bb8c9f5f3141d04f628c34b7fe00419
Closes-Bug: #1339342

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-31 18:44:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "WIP: Allow admin to reboot instances when syncing power states

This re-uses a config option to allow the admin to decide
what should happen when syncing instance power states and nova
thinks the instance is stopped but the hypervisor says it's not.

This is backwards compatible since resume_guests_state_on_host_boot
defaults to False. By rebooting the instance, it will align the
nova database and the hypervisor states.

UpgradeImpact: The resume_guests_state_on_host_boot config option
will now also reboot instances during the _sync_power_states periodic
task.

Change-Id: Ibfd3a1a49c6b9e71af695f09b5bc8690ff31da97
Closes-Bug: #1463688
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Allow admin to reboot instances when syncing power states

This re-uses a config option to allow the admin to decide
what should happen when syncing instance power states and nova
thinks the instance is stopped but the hypervisor says it's not.

This is backwards compatible since resume_guests_state_on_host_boot
defaults to False. By rebooting the instance, it will align the
nova database and the hypervisor states.

UpgradeImpact: The resume_guests_state_on_host_boot config option
will now also reboot instances during the _sync_power_states periodic
task.

Change-Id: Ibfd3a1a49c6b9e71af695f09b5bc8690ff31da97
Closes-Bug: #1463688

commit_message:
Use the oslo.utils.reflection to extract the class name

The oslo.utils reflection module/code handles more variations
of where a class name may come from (on python 2 and python 3)
so its usage allows getting more accurate class names so we might
as well use it.

Change-Id: I625711cd366f6ca355e87f4d5602854aa9de191c

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-17 15:02:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/config.py'], 'message': "Promoting SPICE vm performance(video, sound and other)

Now, More and more enterprises use OpenStack as Desktop Virtualization Platform, it need improving remote display performance and playing music/sound files.
So, this blueprint hope improving display performance and supporting audio in Spice client.

spice channel, (document addr: http://www.libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementCharChannel)
In short, it is a virtual serial port channel, to optimize some communication between the host and virtual machine.
After power up virtual machine, you will find some unknown devices in device manager.
we should install drivers for these devices (drivers download addr is http://www.spice-space.org/download/windows/spice-guest-tools/) .
These drivers contain whole virtual graphics card driver, virtual network card driver and virtual serial port card driver.
this corresponds to the following libvirt XML:
<channel type='spicevmc'>
    <target type='virtio' name='com.redhat.spice.0'/>
      <alias name='virserial-channel1'/>
</channel>

video, this corresponds to the following libvirt XML:
<video>
  <model type='qxl'  vram='65536' heads='1'/>
</video>

sound, this corresponds to the following libvirt XML:
<sound  model='ich6'>
    <address type='pci'  domain='0x0000' bus='0x00' slot='0x04' function='0x0'/>
</sound>

Blueprint libvirt-spice-video-sound-driver

Change-Id: I0f1cec49f0da8a1f27f665cea8efd4e669435c1c

commit_message:
Promoting SPICE vm performance(video, sound and other)

Now, More and more enterprises use OpenStack as Desktop Virtualization Platform, it need improving remote display performance and playing music/sound files.
So, this blueprint hope improving display performance and supporting audio in Spice client.

spice channel, (document addr: http://www.libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementCharChannel)
In short, it is a virtual serial port channel, to optimize some communication between the host and virtual machine.
After power up virtual machine, you will find some unknown devices in device manager.
we should install drivers for these devices (drivers download addr is http://www.spice-space.org/download/windows/spice-guest-tools/) .
These drivers contain whole virtual graphics card driver, virtual network card driver and virtual serial port card driver.
this corresponds to the following libvirt XML:
<channel type='spicevmc'>
    <target type='virtio' name='com.redhat.spice.0'/>
      <alias name='virserial-channel1'/>
</channel>

video, this corresponds to the following libvirt XML:
<video>
  <model type='qxl'  vram='65536' heads='1'/>
</video>

sound, this corresponds to the following libvirt XML:
<sound  model='ich6'>
    <address type='pci'  domain='0x0000' bus='0x00' slot='0x04' function='0x0'/>
</sound>

Blueprint libvirt-spice-video-sound-driver

Change-Id: I0f1cec49f0da8a1f27f665cea8efd4e669435c1c

modify the code format!

Blueprint libvirt-spice-video-sound-driver

Change-Id: I0f1cec49f0da8a1f27f665cea8efd4e669435c1c

modify the code format!

Blueprint libvirt-spice-video-sound-driver

Change-Id: I0f1cec49f0da8a1f27f665cea8efd4e669435c1c

commit_message:
Add uuid into SecurityGroup database model

This commit adds the uuid field into SecurityGroup database model,
it would be used for sync the data for both nova-network and
neutron

Related to blueprint add-id-to-security-groups-for-server-show

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Partial-Bug: #1259292
Change-Id: I1a776cf12e634731dda68165190427034cf62dda

commit_message:
Ephemeral block devices start at xvde for XenAPI

See "DEVICE_EPHEMERAL = '4'" in nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py (where '4'
translates to 'xvde' in zero-based device numbering).

subject: Fix full deploy CI
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-25 23:04:10.000000000', 'files': ['ci-scripts/full-minimal.sh', 'ci-scripts/images.sh', 'ci-scripts/full-deploy.sh'], 'message': "Fix full deploy CI

6926a86c3088f76e00397e58862070ba5e2851e6 broke full
deploy CI, because I forgot to run it before merging.

We also don't need full-minimal.sh and full-deploy.sh.
Keeping full-deploy.sh since it is consistent with
the other CI scripts.

Change-Id: I88deb44d4bec1f740d57ac523b6c1667713f90a1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix full deploy CI

6926a86c3088f76e00397e58862070ba5e2851e6 broke full
deploy CI, because I forgot to run it before merging.

We also don't need full-minimal.sh and full-deploy.sh.
Keeping full-deploy.sh since it is consistent with
the other CI scripts.

Change-Id: I88deb44d4bec1f740d57ac523b6c1667713f90a1

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Partial-Bug: #1259292
Change-Id: Ieb6c89e66e9c53fe381bee6c61163401cb02f730

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-21 11:43:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance.py'], 'message': "Object: Improve Instance _save_flavor

Currently, in instance save() function, we call all fields save handler,
self._save_$attrname(), so _save_flavor, _save_new_flavor and _save_old_flavor
will be called sequentially, since _save_new_flavor and _save_old_flavor
just call _save_flavor, so we don't need to call _save_new_flavor _save_old_flavor
after _save_flavor is called.

Change-Id: I30d960a7c4818963cb539202e9dcf8ec3e712141
"}]
commit_message:
Object: Improve Instance _save_flavor

Currently, in instance save() function, we call all fields save handler,
self._save_$attrname(), so _save_flavor, _save_new_flavor and _save_old_flavor
will be called sequentially, since _save_new_flavor and _save_old_flavor
just call _save_flavor, so we don't need to call _save_new_flavor _save_old_flavor
after _save_flavor is called.

Change-Id: I30d960a7c4818963cb539202e9dcf8ec3e712141

commit_message:
Make evacuate update the migration object along the way

This makes evacuate pass the migration object from api to conductor to
compute so that the migration status and dest_host can be updated during
the process for better progress visibility.

Related to blueprint robustify-evacuate

Change-Id: Ic940ffe449e000535b55697a516ba5199a2d2d60

commit_message:
creating ordinary numa vm fails with large_page_vm

creating ordinary vm may fails with large page vm and ordinary vm on the
same numa node.we can modify the ram_filter to using the ordinary memory
when creating the ordinary vm.

Change-Id: I6bc526b9b25cb7ebb7d1c8df60213d7e981f28c0
Closes-Bug:#1428551

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-25 18:10:46.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'manifests/rabbitmq.pp'], 'message': "Align the stars to bring our CI back alive

This patch squash 2 commits to bring our CI back:

1) Pin Tempest to latest working commit:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297511/ broke us, we need to pin
Tempest to keep rolling.
This will be reverted once we sort things out.

2) rabbitmq: install packages from distro repos

Stop installing RabbitMQ from rabbitmq.com repository.

rabbitmq.com is providing a terrible and frustrating experience of
packaging repository:
* rabbitmq.com is very often down and we have to recheck our jobs
  everytime it happens.

From this patch, we'll deploy RabbitMQ using distro repositories.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-rabbitmq/pull/476

Change-Id: I1e79c04d7cd796493ae56423b70626e8841cf284
"}]
commit_message:
Align the stars to bring our CI back alive

This patch squash 2 commits to bring our CI back:

1) Pin Tempest to latest working commit:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297511/ broke us, we need to pin
Tempest to keep rolling.
This will be reverted once we sort things out.

2) rabbitmq: install packages from distro repos

Stop installing RabbitMQ from rabbitmq.com repository.

rabbitmq.com is providing a terrible and frustrating experience of
packaging repository:
* rabbitmq.com is very often down and we have to recheck our jobs
  everytime it happens.
* packaging signature is currently broken, see [1].

From this patch, we'll deploy RabbitMQ using distro repositories.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-rabbitmq/pull/476

Change-Id: I1e79c04d7cd796493ae56423b70626e8841cf284

commit_message:
Use base Angular template rather than custom template

For reasons outlined in the bug report, this patch uses the base
'angular.html' template.  This has little effect on the functionality at
this point; test by going to the Search panel and verifying that things
look right.

Change-Id: I663ebfdea6f9f9b03e24f3ca73ac3055f3a20e74
Closes-Bug: 1585658

revisions:

This implements a method which builds a list of failed resources that would be
useful to a user to diagnose a stack failure.

Failed resources are added by recursing from the top level stack into failed
nested stack resources. A failed nested stack resource is only added to the
failed list if it contains no failed resources so that the user only sees

Change-Id: I78f15e8b17eda4b463074638c95655129d5a81c0
Blueprint: tripleo-manage-software-deployments
'}]
commit_message:
Implement ViewManager list_stack_failures

This implements a method which builds a list of failed resources that would be
useful to a user to diagnose a stack failure.

Failed resources are added by recursing from the top level stack into failed
nested stack resources. A failed nested stack resource is only added to the
failed list if it contains no failed resources so that the user only sees
root-cause failed resources.

Change-Id: I78f15e8b17eda4b463074638c95655129d5a81c0
Blueprint: tripleo-manage-software-deployments

CLI command which prints failed resources in the overcloud to help debug
overcloud issues.

Failed resources are added by recursing from the top level stack into
failed nested stack resources. A failed nested stack resource is only
added to the failed list if it contains no failed resources so that the
user only sees root-cause failed resources.

The output is a yamlish format where the key is a dot-delimited resource
name path and the value is a dict of resource information.

Change-Id: I6621e9dc2466be8aa27e272c38f5f4dbc8d559c4
Blueprint: tripleo-manage-software-deployments
Depends-On: I78f15e8b17eda4b463074638c95655129d5a81c0
'}]
commit_message:
openstack overcloud failures

CLI command which prints failed resources in the overcloud to help debug
overcloud issues.

Failed resources are added by recursing from the top level stack into
failed nested stack resources. A failed nested stack resource is only
added to the failed list if it contains no failed resources so that the
user only sees root-cause failed resources.

The output is a yamlish format where the key is a dot-delimited resource
name path and the value is a dict of resource information.

Change-Id: I6621e9dc2466be8aa27e272c38f5f4dbc8d559c4
Blueprint: tripleo-manage-software-deployments
Depends-On: I78f15e8b17eda4b463074638c95655129d5a81c0

commit_message:
Initial commit of zuul-worker DIB element

Now that zuulv2.5 has landed, we can start building our DIBs using the
new zuul-worker element.  As part of the jenkins clean up, we'll
eventually be removing all things jenkins from our puppet manifests.

As we move forward, we'll be using DIB to bootstrap our zuul-workers
over puppet.

Change-Id: I0e76931fdb4ca0c7445b1e72dc348f0cf03eaee5
Depends-On: Idb4ef11576671180060fb5b2b1202f9bfec5fd47
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Skip ES lookups on runs with missing metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-25 15:51:14.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/tests/test_api.py', 'openstack_health/api.py'], 'message': "Skip ES lookups on runs with missing metadata

This commit fixes a bug when the data returned from subunit2sql is
missing the required fields, like in the case of periodic jobs, to
use the elastic-recheck classifier. Previously it was assumed all
runs being returned from subunit2sql would have an associated change
and the metadata associated with that, but this wasn't always true.
So now it will just skip trying to do an ES lookup if all the required
fields aren't present.

Change-Id: I395656c94499f658df1dd20cafa0783e394bc382
"}]
commit_message:
Skip ES lookups on runs with missing metadata

This commit fixes a bug when the data returned from subunit2sql is
missing the required fields, like in the case of periodic jobs, to
use the elastic-recheck classifier. Previously it was assumed all
runs being returned from subunit2sql would have an associated change
and the metadata associated with that, but this wasn't always true.
So now it will just skip trying to do an ES lookup if all the required
fields aren't present.

Change-Id: I395656c94499f658df1dd20cafa0783e394bc382

commit_message:
Add API Change Tutorial

This change adds a tutorial for making an API change. It describes from
the specification proposal to making real code changes in keystone.

Its goal is to help new contributors to get familiar with keystone code.
It simulates the addition of a 'description' field to role entities.

Change-Id: Ie6f302939f43e78f07183abf4bc5aadb6b50ef1c
