commit_message:
Specify a user-agent in Pure volume drivers

Previously we were just using the default user-agent that the python
requests module would send. With newer versions of the pure storage
python module you can now specify a custom one.

This will help to identify on the backend what requests are being
sent by the VolumeDriver vs other python scripts running against the
same array.

As part of this we will also remove support for the older version of
the python module. The newer versions are released and easily upgraded
to.

Change-Id: Icf8595843e38381c6704fd6a9c66b752f91337a5
Closes-Bug: #1579194

subject: 3PAR Clean up VLUN deletion on detach
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 17:39:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_hpe3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py'], 'message': '3PAR Clean up VLUN deletion on detach

This patch fixes an issue where template VLUNs are left
behind during a detach.  This can happen when a volume is
exported via multiple ports to support multipath and at
detach time one of those paths becomes inactive, bad nic,
pulled cable, etc.

The 3PAR inactive VLUNs are actually templates.  When you
delete a template VLUN, all active VLUNs associated with
that template are also removed.  This patch deletes
template VLUNs at detach time.

Change-Id: If34b76e58684138ca2acb8d38587fb30cfbd5909
Closes-Bug: #1582922
(cherry picked from commit 9b24d615cf78ce7e8d5bac714f63845210bce6ba)
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR Clean up VLUN deletion on detach

This patch fixes an issue where template VLUNs are left
behind during a detach.  This can happen when a volume is
exported via multiple ports to support multipath and at
detach time one of those paths becomes inactive, bad nic,
pulled cable, etc.

The 3PAR inactive VLUNs are actually templates.  When you
delete a template VLUN, all active VLUNs associated with
that template are also removed.  This patch deletes
template VLUNs at detach time.

Change-Id: If34b76e58684138ca2acb8d38587fb30cfbd5909
Closes-Bug: #1582922
(cherry picked from commit 9b24d615cf78ce7e8d5bac714f63845210bce6ba)

commit_message:
Assisted snapshot:  use Keystone Session with Nova Client

The Nova client has trouble dealing with Keystone V3 or unversioned
Keystone endpoint, when instantiated without a Keystone Session. Thus
we can't instantiate Nova client directly as cinder.compute.nova
does currently.

Keystone V3 and unversioned service catalog is the future (see [1]
and [2]) so we should adapt.

Please read comments #5, #6 and #11 of the related bug report.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/271508/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302480/

Change-Id: Ic790955e677c5dfa47680bf619c57fba3deeee20
Related-Bug: #1522402

commit_message:
Get endpoint if os_image_url is not set

If env['OS_IMAGE_URL'] is not set then None is returned. This is then
used ignoring the endpoint_type, service_type and region_name. This
patch will use those values if the endpoint is None.

Change-Id: I76cc527b05d2be75d3dbc33123a0d71be97fe25c
Closes-bug: #1579768
(cherry picked from commit a862196cfb7f7323b1864b4c1660c39850487a64)

commit_message:
Get endpoint if os_image_url is not set

If env['OS_IMAGE_URL'] is not set then None is returned. This is then
used ignoring the endpoint_type, service_type and region_name. This
patch will use those values if the endpoint is None.

Change-Id: I76cc527b05d2be75d3dbc33123a0d71be97fe25c
Closes-bug: #1579768
(cherry picked from commit a862196cfb7f7323b1864b4c1660c39850487a64)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated tempest_lib and use tempest.lib

Since 10.0.0 release tempest-ib is deprecated now.
Cinderclient should use tempest.lib in test code
and add tempest>=11.0.0 in requirements following
global-requirements.

Closes-Bug: #1583583
Change-Id: I9d766f46eb6fff29ae9c0267a60ff2ef4bf2343e

Create the releasenotes directory and add the requisite
conf.py file to generate python-manilaclient's release notes.

Change-Id: I6b0fa6016781a252a71649a7cac85f02b0a019e8

commit_message:
Disable the netconsole service (if present)

This patch checks for the netconsole service on a host and disables the
service, if the service is installed. The service will be stopped
immediately if it is found to be running.

Documentation and release notes are included.

Closes-bug: 1584194

Change-Id: If779af67c2a66e7b56d170f1f12744aef75ff27b

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-24 08:40:46.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/sleep-ebe58fbe07d30219.yaml', 'ironic_python_agent/agent.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_agent.py', 'ironic_python_agent/cmd/agent.py'], 'message': 'Add a configurable sleep before IPA starts working

Some kernel modules take substantial time to initialize. For example,
with mpt2sas RAID driver inspection and deployment randomly fail
due to IPA starting before the driver finishes initialization.

As much as I hate it, the only way to guarantee that the hardware is
truely initalized is to wait for it. Apparently all hardware in Linux
is treated as hotplugged, so there is no such thing as "hardware
initialization is finished". Operators can add a sleep based on their
knowledge of their hardware.

The default behaviour remains the same.

Change-Id: I0446ae81d760dacaf31eea6ad9f9eaa098cf5e93
Partial-Bug: #1582797
'}]
commit_message:
Add a configurable sleep before IPA starts working

Some kernel modules take substantial time to initialize. For example,
with mpt2sas RAID driver inspection and deployment randomly fail
due to IPA starting before the driver finishes initialization.

As much as I hate it, the only way to guarantee that the hardware is
truely initalized is to wait for it. Apparently all hardware in Linux
is treated as hotplugged, so there is no such thing as "hardware
initialization is finished". Operators can add a sleep based on their
knowledge of their hardware.

The default behaviour remains the same.

Change-Id: I0446ae81d760dacaf31eea6ad9f9eaa098cf5e93
Partial-Bug: #1582797

subject: Added package references to generated UIs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 17:05:56.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/plugins/cloudify_plugin/murano_cloudify_plugin/cloudify_tosca_package.py', 'murano/packages/hot_package.py', 'contrib/plugins/murano_heat-translator_plugin/plugin/csar_package.py'], 'message': "Added package references to generated UIs

Generated UIs of the non-muranoPL packages (HOT, cloudify_tosca and
CSAR) reference the type of object model's object by class FQNs.
However, when these packages are uploaded to glare, their class
contents are not indexed since the client which uploads them has no
knowledge of the generated classes.

To workaround this issue it is proposed to reference objects not just
by class FQNs but to include the package FQN and the version, so the
engine does not have to rely on Glare's indexes.

Change-Id: I6175e89b68bcdfc29d33ae3616d6ecba662f2509
Partial-bug: #1565805
"}]
commit_message:
Added package references to generated UIs

Generated UIs of the non-muranoPL packages (HOT, cloudify_tosca and
CSAR) reference the type of object model's object by class FQNs.
However, when these packages are uploaded to glare, their class
contents are not indexed since the client which uploads them has no
knowledge of the generated classes.

To workaround this issue it is proposed to reference objects not just
by class FQNs but to include the package FQN and the version, so the
engine does not have to rely on Glare's indexes.

Change-Id: I6175e89b68bcdfc29d33ae3616d6ecba662f2509
Partial-bug: #1565805

commit_message:
move most things out from the playbooks dir, and use config for release info

* move the roles, libraries and config to a top level dir
* adjust the ansible.cfg to account for the new role path
* create a config directory
  config/release  <- only for release and image_url info
  config/general_config <- everything else
* update collect-logs role path
* add ci-scripts/full-minimal.sh so that jjb will not have
to be updated after this.

Change-Id: I2e6129553bca253fa47ce56bfcbc2f244e74409e

commit_message:
Release Puppet OpenStack 7.1.0 (Liberty)

This patch adds a new release of Puppet OpenStack modules for our
Liberty branches.

All modules will be tagged 7.1.0 (7.x.x) is our Liberty versionning
except puppet-vswitch that will have 3.1.0.

Change-Id: Iaf5f160ccd8baa78c2b93bc7000e6cd5a2e59caf

subject: Fix auditd log permission bug
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-25 14:22:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-notes/V-38498.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-audit-log-permission-bug-81a772e2e6d0a5b3.yaml', 'tasks/auditd.yml'], 'message': 'Fix auditd log permission bug

The tasks for handling auditd log permissions incorrectly set all
log files in /var/log/audit to 0400, which prevents auditd from
writing to the active log file. This prevents auditd from starting and
restarting.

The task now removes any permissions explicitly disallowed by
V-38498. Any files meeting/exceeding the STIG requirements will not be
modified.

This is a manual backport of I1bb2b91ae8a78b1f0304bd4ce0f9a774d65245bd
from master.

Closes-bug: 1584942

Change-Id: I1bb2b91ae8a78b1f0304bd4ce0f9a774d65245bd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix auditd log permission bug

The tasks for handling auditd log permissions incorrectly set all
log files in /var/log/audit to 0400, which prevents auditd from
writing to the active log file. This prevents auditd from starting and
restarting.

The task now removes any permissions explicitly disallowed by
V-38498. Any files meeting/exceeding the STIG requirements will not be
modified.

This is a manual backport of I1bb2b91ae8a78b1f0304bd4ce0f9a774d65245bd
from master.

Closes-bug: 1584942

Change-Id: I1bb2b91ae8a78b1f0304bd4ce0f9a774d65245bd

commit_message:
Added package references to generated UIs

Generated UIs of the non-muranoPL packages (HOT, cloudify_tosca and
CSAR) reference the type of object model's object by class FQNs.
However, when these packages are uploaded to glare, their class
contents are not indexed since the client which uploads them has no
knowledge of the generated classes.

To workaround this issue it is proposed to reference objects not just
by class FQNs but to include the package FQN and the version, so the
engine does not have to rely on Glare's indexes.

Change-Id: I6175e89b68bcdfc29d33ae3616d6ecba662f2509
Partial-bug: #1565805

commit_message:
Deprecate advertise_mtu option

Now that we advertise MTU via DHCP and RA by default, there is no reason
to keep the option available for configuration. Other agents/plugins are
also encouraged to advertise MTU values to instances by their own means.

DocImpact: mark the advertise_mtu option as deprecated as of Newton.

Closes-Bug: 1576000
Change-Id: Ibf7d60dfc57bec090f16d909c050c09e7cfd9352

commit_message:
Grammar: requires -> required

"requires" sort of makes sense in the variable name ("keystone requires
these pip packages), but as a task name, the task is "installing the
required pip packages." #ultranit

Change-Id: I3dcdc30e26edbcb049189daa895f5932cf8e2feb

Add support for releasenotes

Create the releasenotes directory and add the requisite

commit_message:
Remove k8s pods, rcs, svc and container API calls

Magnum supports multiple COEs however it contains APIs that only work
with Kubernetes. We will allow additional API extensions for specific
bay drivers to allow access to the k8s APIs through Magnum. This will
allow us to support multiple COEs without having to compromise the
container API to the lowest common denominator between COEs.

Change-Id: Ic6927f77f413f5202a3dd160ff809c7ec057d3b5

commit_message:
Make the ssh driver work on headless VirtualBox machines

On a workstation where an X display might not currently be running
or a workstation where someone else is logged on the graphical
desktop this small change helps get things working for using
VirtualBox as the hypervisor. Use VirtualBox 3.2 or above
for headless mode support.

This patch also ensures that set_boot_device() always works by powering
off the VM before setting the device. VirtualBox does not allow boot
device to be set while the machine is on.

Closes-Bug: 1561624

Change-Id: If8d989cc3964e849544b139959b329a3fd05d451

commit_message:
Remove APIRouter of legacy v2 API code

This patch removes the APIRouter because there is not any code
which uses the APIRouter. In addition, this patch update the
corresponding reno for explaining actual way for api-paste.ini.

Partially implements blueprint remove-legacy-v2-api-code

Change-Id: I136eb6ce7478f9ff692ebcbe1b14aa76222826bf

commit_message:
Searchlight version of hz-expand-detail

Unfortunately, upstream has modified hz-expand-detail to *require*
that it be used only as part of hz-table. This otherwise convenient
utility locks searchlight-ui into using hz-table and smart table
where it doesn't really want to.

See: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1580809

This change paves the way for a follow-on that removes the use of
smart table.

Change-Id: Iea3dd2007f642b68e91523bc0838ea7b5836bf12
Implements: blueprint data-binding-over-events

commit_message:
Unsupported module driver not logged correctly

If an invalid module driver is found, the method is erroneously
printed out instead of the actual 'type.'  This is due
to missing parenthesis in the logging call.

This has been fixed.

Change-Id: I6fb23b3dbbec98de9ee1e2731bcfc56ab3c0ca42
Closes-Bug: #1579900

revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2016-05-25 04:05:20.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/paths.py', 'ironic/common/service.py', 'ironic/netconf.py', 'ironic/conf/__init__.py', 'releasenotes/notes/adopt-oslo-config-generator-15afd2e7c2f008b4.yaml', 'tools/config/generate_sample.sh', 'tools/config/oslo.config.generator.rc', 'ironic/common/utils.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'tools/config/check_uptodate.sh', 'ironic/common/config_generator/generator.py', 'tools/config/ironic-config-generator.conf', 'ironic/conf/opts.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Make use of oslo-config-generator

oslo_config provide a utility for generating sample config files,
which provide more detail about opts, like Minimum/Maximum value
and Allowed values.
So drop Ironic's "generate_sample.sh" which was copied from
oslo-incubator long time ago.

Add a new entry point "ironic" under oslo.config.opts namespace to
explore config options to oslo-config-generator.

After this patch, new config options of Ironic code should register
with ironic/conf/opts.py. New external libraries should
register with tools/config/ironic-config-generator.conf

There is a bug #1554657 with oslo-config about deprecated_group.
This bug have impact of some configs from keystonemiddleware
and oslo.messaging in ironic.conf.sample
So currently, deprecated option should always add the deprecated_group
even it didn't alter the group, otherwise the deprecated group value will
be 'DEFAULT'.

Update etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample via running 'tox -egenconfig'.

Closes-Bug: #1564195
Change-Id: If7721e98e69b6f54f1ee04a07477396b86583371
'}]
commit_message:
Make use of oslo-config-generator

oslo_config provide a utility for generating sample config files,
which provide more detail about opts, like Minimum/Maximum value
and Allowed values.
So drop Ironic's "generate_sample.sh" which was copied from
oslo-incubator long time ago.

Add a new entry point "ironic" under oslo.config.opts namespace to
explore config options to oslo-config-generator.

After this patch, new config options of Ironic code should register
with ironic/conf/opts.py. New external libraries should
register with tools/config/ironic-config-generator.conf

There is a bug #1554657 with oslo-config about deprecated_group.
This bug have impact of some configs from keystonemiddleware
and oslo.messaging in ironic.conf.sample
So currently, deprecated option should always add the deprecated_group
even it didn't alter the group, otherwise the deprecated group value will
be 'DEFAULT'.

Update etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample via running 'tox -egenconfig'.

Closes-Bug: #1564195
Change-Id: If7721e98e69b6f54f1ee04a07477396b86583371

commit_message:
keystone: fix catalog output when region is unset

If no region is set in Keystone, null is deserialized as None and the
region has None has value, which triggers a type error when building the
output string.

This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I7637dc2595655cf452f38308f99fe66ac782e16d

commit_message:
VMware: Increase default task poll interval

Currently the default interval to poll vCenter tasks is 0.5s
which is too low for tasks initiated by the VMDK driver. This
patch increases the default task poll interval to 2s to reduce
the load on vCenter caused by excessive task polling.

Change-Id: I4151ac3fc179bda88724cda8fbbfb67abc4fec33
Related-bug: #1556902

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-23 20:10:01.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ceph_client/tasks/ceph_install_python_libs.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ceph_client/tasks/ceph_all.yml', 'playbooks/os-glance-install.yml'], 'message': "Create ceph python library symlinks

Currently, os_nova, os_cinder, and os_glance roles all install
python-cephlibs, which is a python package Hugh Saunders created for
Ceph Hammer python libraries.  The virtualenvs created in these roles
need access to these python libraries and by using Hugh's python
package we could simply pip install into the virtualenv.

This has been working fine, but makes the assumption that the deployer
is using Ceph Hammer, which may not be true.  Also, later versions of
Ceph have python C extensions, which may be more difficult to package.

This commit simply leverages the existing Ceph libraries installed
outside of the venv by checking for the path of the library using
python itself.

NOTE: I would prefer to use a None instead of '' in the ternaries,
but seem to hit issues doing that.

Change-Id: Iac3b04eec57f6d1aa21051f2960d56e3b47b6f00
"}]
commit_message:
Create ceph python library symlinks

Currently, os_nova, os_cinder, and os_glance roles all install
python-cephlibs, which is a python package Hugh Saunders created for
Ceph Hammer python libraries.  The virtualenvs created in these roles
need access to these python libraries and by using Hugh's python
package we could simply pip install into the virtualenv.

This has been working fine, but makes the assumption that the deployer
is using Ceph Hammer, which may not be true.  Also, later versions of
Ceph have python C extensions, which may be more difficult to package.

This commit simply leverages the existing Ceph libraries installed
outside of the venv by checking for the path of the library using
python itself.

NOTE: I would prefer to use a None instead of '' in the ternaries,
but seem to hit issues doing that.

Change-Id: Iac3b04eec57f6d1aa21051f2960d56e3b47b6f00

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-01 02:53:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py'], 'message': 'Add a config option named rbd_flatten_volume_from_image

Suppose glance and cinder uses ceph rbd driver as storage backend,
cinder and glance are in the same ceph storage cluster.

If cinder creates a volume from an image, it could create
a clonevolume from that image, and the relationship is
image-->clone snapshot-->clone image. If we want a higher performance
rbd image than the clone image,we should flatten the clone image to
meet the application requirements.

So it’s necessary to add a config option named rbd_flatten_volume_from_image
to decide whether to flatten rbd clone image or not. If rbd clone image was
flattened, cinder should also delete the clone_snap.

Change-Id: Ife35f19fcdee6c193b83289ca465b7ac25386808
Implements: blueprint rbd-flatten-clone-image
Closes-Bug: 1374256
'}]
commit_message:
Add a config option named rbd_flatten_volume_from_image

Suppose glance and cinder uses ceph rbd driver as storage backend,
cinder and glance are in the same ceph storage cluster.

If cinder creates a volume from an image, it could create
a clonevolume from that image, and the relationship is
image-->clone snapshot-->clone image. If we want a higher performance
rbd image than the clone image,we should flatten the clone image to
meet the application requirements.

So it’s necessary to add a config option named rbd_flatten_volume_from_image
to decide whether to flatten rbd clone image or not. If rbd clone image was
flattened, cinder should also delete the clone_snap.

Change-Id: Ife35f19fcdee6c193b83289ca465b7ac25386808
Implements: blueprint rbd-flatten-clone-image
Closes-Bug: 1374256

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-11 07:46:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_dellscapi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/zonemanager/test_cisco_fc_zone_driver.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_backup.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_hitachi_hnas_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_backup_ceph.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_emc_vmax.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/test_api.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_ibm_xiv_ds8k.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_drbdmanagedrv.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_emc_vnxdirect.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/zonemanager/test_brcd_fc_zone_driver.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_context.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_hpelefthand.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/v2/test_volumes.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_filters.py'], 'message': 'Use assertIn and assertNotIn

Tests should use:
    self.assertIn(value, list)
    self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
    self.assertTrue(value in list)
    self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
    self.assertIn(3, [1, 2])
    >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]
    self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
    >>> AssertionError: False is not true

Change-Id: Ie2c6de7d769f298db4cc4712b70cb20e9cac588b
Related-Bug: #1218713
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertIn and assertNotIn

Tests should use:
    self.assertIn(value, list)
    self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
    self.assertTrue(value in list)
    self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
    self.assertIn(3, [1, 2])
    >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]
    self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
    >>> AssertionError: False is not true

Change-Id: Ie2c6de7d769f298db4cc4712b70cb20e9cac588b
Related-Bug: #1218713

commit_message:
Https Support

In terms of using https for python monasca-log-api
i've discovered a Bug in gunicorn which makes
running with ssl mode impossible. This bug
(https://github.com/benoitc/gunicorn/issues/1177) is
fixed in gunicorn version 19.5.0.

Change-Id: Ia2163243786677e81ff002ac7f65f43080058d5c

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-05-18 18:31:48.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks/services_checks.py', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks/libs/thread_pool.py'], 'message': 'Rework agent to better handle multithreaded checks

The custom thread_pool could not restart in certain cases due to limitations
with python threads.  This moves to using multiprocessing.dummy for the thread
pool and gevent to allow thread timeouts.

Also cleans up some of the asynchronous logic.
Pools have constant numbers of threads, so thread count is checked at pool creation
No longer tracks job start time, as this is handled by timeouts.
Move resultsq instantiation so pool restart does not drop data.
Mark checks as done at end of run rather than when results are processed.

Closes-Bug: 1446757

Change-Id: I28bdd8d8404087097bff9f93ff60f5cc86a72fbb
'}]
commit_message:
Rework agent to better handle multithreaded checks

The custom thread_pool could not restart in certain cases due to limitations
with python threads.  This moves to using multiprocessing.dummy for the thread
pool and gevent to allow thread timeouts.

Also cleans up some of the asynchronous logic.
Pools have constant numbers of threads, so thread count is checked at pool creation
No longer tracks job start time, as this is handled by timeouts.
Move resultsq instantiation so pool restart does not drop data.
Mark checks as done at end of run rather than when results are processed.

Closes-Bug: 1446757

Change-Id: I28bdd8d8404087097bff9f93ff60f5cc86a72fbb

commit_message:
Colour Code HTTP Methods

Most API Docs seem to colour code the HTTP methods to make
for easier reading.

This sets:

	GET / HEAD 	- Blue
	POST 		- Green
	PATCH/PUT 	- Yellow
	DELETE		- Red

By reuseing some of the bootstrap label-* css.

Change-Id: Ic58edeb672ced1e66849c561133f272982abcb4e

subject: Remove nova_* options from guestagent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 14:34:16.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/guestagent.pp', 'spec/classes/trove_guestagent_spec.rb'], 'message': "Remove nova_* options from guestagent

These options are unncessary according to Tesora, and they are a
security risk. The nova user has admin privelges. If your use spins up a
trove instance then snapshots it, they'd be able to get admin
credentials in your cloud.

Change-Id: Ie1f46fde9369033315e299e01d5c7f848bdd2696
"}]
commit_message:
Remove nova_* options from guestagent

These options are unncessary according to Tesora, and they are a
security risk. The nova user has admin privelges. If your use spins up a
trove instance then snapshots it, they'd be able to get admin
credentials in your cloud.

Change-Id: Ie1f46fde9369033315e299e01d5c7f848bdd2696

NOTE: This patch just removes the test of createserverext extension
      which is not documented and not tested with Tempest.
      The extension is not implemented and seems unnecessary legacy.
      Let's remove the test.

Partially implements blueprint remove-legacy-v2-api-code

Change-Id: I0eaa0a9860af7d574a689722785d5d3d614eb0c1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove legacy v2 API tests which use wsgi_app()

There is fakes.wsgi_app() for testing legacy v2 API code, but the
method becomes unnecessary. So this patch removes the method and
unit tests which used the method for legacy v2 API.

NOTE: This patch just removes the test of createserverext extension
      which is not documented and not tested with Tempest.
      The extension is not implemented and seems unnecessary legacy.
      Let's remove the test.

Partially implements blueprint remove-legacy-v2-api-code

Change-Id: I0eaa0a9860af7d574a689722785d5d3d614eb0c1

commit_message:
[WIP] Improve gate testing for security role

This patch removes the skipped tags in tox.ini and carefully skips
some problematic tasks using conditionals. This enables more of the tasks
to run in the gate but skips some failures that would normally cause
the gate job to break.

Change-Id: Idfabf33073715e74eca757078a1c2a9c745d6cf9

commit_message:
Revert "modify firewall_driver"

Short names are supported, and have been for a long time via PBR magic.

See Ia04fb7dd352707cd372a6c710df0f230dce3c5a0 for the original patches
that introduced using the short names.


This reverts commit 9a34c13dac17b24c794a6e2e87882aabe8c6fddd.

Change-Id: Ic7451f1d140f760ac41cda04e421baa2f9e55924

Failure to do so can cause errors in certain 2.x versions

Change-Id: Icfc22769f2415a9e86eb843e1228291f0849218b
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure all role dependencies are consistently specified

We should always specify the 'scm' and 'version' attribute
for every role we depend upon.

Failure to do so can cause errors in certain 2.x versions
of Ansible.

Change-Id: Icfc22769f2415a9e86eb843e1228291f0849218b

commit_message:
Include patches recursively in RPM package

Parametrize the RPM spec with python2 macros and add
patches to  the build directory recursively  to make
sure that all of them are included.

Change-Id: I49488776047b32b0a939bbbe435c0c286eabedee
Closes-bug: 1585528

template versions so that we can manage
adding pseudo-parameters over time.

commit_message:
Add option to enable introspection of UEFI nodes

By default, ironic-inspector does not support introspection of machines
with UEFI-only firmware. This allows deployers to turn this on.

Change-Id: Ie742ea49ec77f5b334a8e4479803af5dd6d25047

commit_message:
Move parameters from stack to raw_template

parameters/environment is temlpate specific and bettter
to be held under raw_template. Also this will help in
moving towards backup stack removal.

Change-Id: Iefa34cf8990ea079d92bfaf37fbc7ede5ab8ff13
Implements: blueprint persisting-graph-and-resrouce-versioning
